subject: Law
title: What Is Intellectual Property?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Intellectual Property?.

hook.text: You can't touch it, hold it, or lock it in a safe. Yet intellectual property is worth trillions of dollars.

buildup.text: Intellectual property is a creation of the mind: inventions, designs, artistic works, names, and symbols.

discovery.text: IP law grants creators exclusive rights to control and profit from their creations for a limited time.

twist.text: Without IP protection, creators would have less incentive to innovateâ€”anyone could copy their work instantly.

climax.text: The four main types are patents, copyrights, trademarks, and trade secrets. Each protects different things.

punchline.text: Ideas aren't property. But the expression of ideas is.

quiz.question: What are the four main types of intellectual property?
